meanings.definition: The ability to be supported or upheld.
meanings.sent1: The supportability of the shelf was tested by placing heavy books on it.
meanings.sent2: The bridge's supportability was crucial in ensuring the safety of the travelers.
meanings.sent3: The supportability of the hammock was put to the test when the cat decided to join.
meanings.sent4: Her supportability in times of need was like a sturdy pillar holding everything together.
meanings.sent5: The supportability of the tree branch was evident as it held the weight of the swinging child.

meanings.definition: The quality of being able to provide support or assistance.
meanings.sent1: The team's supportability was evident as they worked together to achieve their goal.
meanings.sent2: The supportability of the charity organization helped many families in need.
meanings.sent3: The kitten's attempt to offer supportability to the puppy was adorable but ineffective.
meanings.sent4: Her supportability shone through as she guided her friend through a difficult situation.
meanings.sent5: The supportability of the safety net saved the acrobat from a dangerous fall.
